New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto allowed only one hit and one earned run in 6 1/3 innings, setting a new career mark in the World Series.
Freddie Freeman hit home runs in both games of the World Series, tying him with Babe Ruth for the most consecutive series games with a home run (5).
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sustained a shoulder injury while attempting to steal second base, leaving the game and raising concerns about his participation.
The Dodgers held a 2-0 series lead, putting pressure on the Yankees to win Game 3 to avoid elimination.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts called Ohtani's injury a 'little' subluxation and noted the team would monitor his condition.
Yankees faced a must-win situation in Game 3 with Clarke Schmidt set to pitch against Walker Buehler.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers have historically dominated World Series with a 32-9 record.
Vegas odds heavily favored the Dodgers to win the series, listing them at -400 compared to the Yankees' +310.
Others: Shohei Ohtani's injury loomed large, potentially altering the Dodgers' playoff run, while his performance in the regular season was highlighted by 59 steals in 63 attempts.
